newsitem.title: HONG KONG: Onfem shares surge on MQ acquisition.
newsitem.headline: Onfem shares surge on MQ acquisition.

text.p: Shares of Onfem Holdings Ltd surged after the company announced plans of buying into a U.S.-based magnet maker, brokers said on Tuesday.
"Anticipation that the purchase can benefit its earnings in future aided short-term demand for the shares," said one sales manager at regional brokerage.
Onfem shares rose HK$0.525 or 12.57 percent to HK$4.175 each in mid morning after a one-day trading suspension. Volume was 14.32 million shares worth HK$60.91 million.
Onfem said on Monday it would buy a 62 percent stake in the U.S.-based MQ Holdings in a bid to enter into the magnetic materials industry.

The purchase will give Onfem an indirect 37.2 percent stake in MQ Holdings's 60 percent-owned Magnequench International Inc, which manufactures and markets neodymium magnets for use in computers, electronic appliances and motor vehicles.
